DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of aplastic anemia classification severity.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Anemia resulting from bone marrow failure (aplastic or hypoplastic bone marrow).  The production of erythroblasts and red cells is markedly decreased, and it may be associated with decreased production of granulocytes (granulocytopenia) and platelets (thrombocytopenia) as well.  Aplastic anemia may be idiopathic or secondary due to bone marrow damage by toxins, radiation, or immunologic factors. -- 2004 _A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the bone marrow is unable to produce blood cells.

Concepts.definition: Anemia resulting from bone marrow failure (aplastic or hypoplastic bone marrow). The production of erythroblasts and red cells is markedly decreased, and it may be associated with decreased production of granulocytes (granulocytopenia) and platelets (thrombocytopenia) as well. Aplastic anemia may be idiopathic or secondary due to bone marrow damage by toxins, radiation, or immunologic factors.

Property.preferredDefinition: Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the bone marrow is unable to produce blood cells._Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Aplastic anemia that is characterized by bone marrow cellularity less than 30% and does not meet criteria for severe aplastic anemia.

Concepts.definition: Aplastic anemia that is characterized by bone marrow cellularity less than 30% and does not meet criteria for severe aplastic anemia.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Severe Aplastic Anemia Or Very Severe Aplastic Anemia

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Severe Aplastic Anemia Or Very Severe Aplastic Anemia
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Life-threatening anemia associated with a high risk of infection or bleeding.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Aplastic anemia that is characterized by bone marrow (BM) cellularity less than 25% (or less than 50% if BM is comprised of less than 30% hematopoietic cells), and two or more of the following: absolute neutrophil count of less than 200 per microliter; platelet count of less than 20,000 per microliter; or an absolute reticulocyte count of less than 20,000 per microliter.

Concepts.definition: Life-threatening anemia associated with a high risk of infection or bleeding.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Aplastic anemia that is characterized by bone marrow (BM) cellularity less than 25% (or less than 50% if BM is comprised of less than 30% hematopoietic cells), and two or more of the following: absolute neutrophil count of less than 200 per microliter; platelet count of less than 20,000 per microliter; or an absolute reticulocyte count of less than 20,000 per microliter.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the bone marrow is unable to produce blood cells.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Anemia resulting from bone marrow failure (aplastic or hypoplastic bone marrow). The production of erythroblasts and red cells is markedly decreased, and it may be associated with decreased production of granulocytes (granulocytopenia) and platelets (thrombocytopenia) as well. Aplastic anemia may be idiopathic or secondary due to bone marrow damage by toxins, radiation, or immunologic factors.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
